website_summaries.verdict: One of the best middle-of-the-road card readers that is both USB 2.0 and 3.0 compatible.
pros: Comes with three reader slots for different types of cards
Fast transfer speeds when working with photos and video
Large card reader is still small enough to fit in a pocket or small bag
cons: Varied results with different versions of SD memory cards

customer_reviews.title: Here is the cable connector.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is USB3, yes the cable is included. What they never say or show is that the cable is a USB 3.0 micro. If you need a reader with 18" of cable then this will work for you, if you need to get it from the back of your computer to the front then this will likely NOT be long enough and you will have to add a USB3.0 extension cable, or purchase a longer (or shorter) one. Review revised 8/1/2015 after correction by another user.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: I had a good 64gb of pictures and video piled up in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a quicker access to files from SD card and microSD card from my Sony RX100V and DJI Mavic. I had a good 64gb of pictures and video piled up in the SD card from the RX100V and it was the first card I tried with this reader. It was working perfectly fine with my camera, the moment I plugged the card into this reader, the card became CORRUPTED! WASTED 6HRS trying to recover all the pictures I had. Everything works okay now but what a pain it was. Because of this, I can't recommend this reader to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: V. Truong

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect this thing to last
customer_reviews.text: I used this several times, maybe once a month. However, this will only last you a few years. Besides the cheap plastic build that you'd expect with any other cheap, chinese-manufactured electronic device, the internals are not meant to last longer than a few years. I was correct about this when my Transcend reader started cutting out on me, and now it is virtually unusable. Try to transfer anything from any card, the transcend dies. Fortunately, I have a few other readers and they work well. Two of which I have had for 4 and 8 years, respectively. The Transcend RDF5K is MUCH more reliable than this one (RDF8K).
customer_reviews.author: Hapa

customer_reviews.title: send a reader card and they can't read.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card reader because it said it works best with Apple products. I tried it and it didn't work. I contacted them and told them the year of my computer and the brand of card I was using, they suggested a variety of ways to use the card reader and none of the ways worked in my situation. Then they stopped returning my emails. I am left with a CF card that no reader will read.
customer_reviews.author: Lee J

customer_reviews.title: Snappy, reliable card reader
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for reading CF cards. It works as advertised. It's small enough that it doesn't clutter my desk. Transfer speeds are impressive. It's USB 3 compatible, but my computer only has USB 2 ports. Even at USB 2 speeds, I can still copy over a 1GB files from my CF card in about 10-15 seconds. My only minor complaint is the always-on blue LED light that shines out of the top of the device; it can be quite bright in a dark room. I unplug mine when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: "Gimpy" Peach Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Between photography, phones, computers, this was a great find. I did some research and after trial and error and many different readers this has been a blessing, made my digital media life easier. All in one I have used every port on it they all work well. The compact flash slot if you have that card like I do for an older camera just mind your careful and insert yours correctly so the pins match up. Two months in and no complaints it's very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Othermom

customer_reviews.title: It works!  It doesn't corrupt my memory cards!
customer_reviews.text: It works. I went through several cheap card readers for reading Compact Flash cards from my camera. I found that some of the cheap readers would actually corrupt the card -- just inserting a card into the reader causing me to lose all the images, especially on a newer 256GB card. This one worked flawlessly out of the box. It's fast, too. It's more compact and more aesthetically pleasing to use than the Kingston model (which I also recommend because it also works fine at about the same price). I wish it weren't USB3.0, but it's hard to find a good USB2.0 model anymore.
customer_reviews.author: A discerning consumer

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these items. The first one lasted a couple years and while I wished it lasted longer, it worked well. I wasn't sure if I'd dropped it sometime or what, but it just stopped working. So, I purchased another one. This one lasted 3 months! Yikes. No more. I don't move it around much, just sits on my desk for when I want to transfer photos from my compact flash cards for my DSLR. Speed was fine, but I won't purchase any more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in MO

customer_reviews.title: Dependable workhorse flash card reader
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over three years and have used it continually with a Windows 7 system. I like the size, the form factor, and that it has never failed once. I use it to read SD cards and Compact Flash cards, and rarely micro SD cards. After I bought it, I like it enough to buy a second in white for travel, and have used that one as well, though less frequently. The only negative is that it can read only one SD or micro SD card at the same time. You can't have two cards inserted and read both at the same time in this reader, though you can use CF and SD/microSD cards at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Mind and Hand

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for use with SD cards and Compact Flash cards
customer_reviews.text: I have used this extensively, almost daily, with both my sd cards and my compact flash cards (one at a time). I have not had any trouble with using it, and it works quickly and well. I had an old one that was just for compact flash cards, and it was fine, but this one is very nice to use. No problems so far. I have had it less than a year, so I may update for reliability later, but so far, it seems well made and prefect to me!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne K. Endres

customer_reviews.title: Slots Deep Enough to Keep Pins Safe
customer_reviews.text: It is as fast as the 3.0 reader it replaced. My biggest concern in buying this was that the depth of the CF card slot may not be deep enough to prevent bent pins. That is a common problem with card readers, probably because they compete to be the smallest reader. I am happy to say the slots on this reader are deep enough that you don't have to worry about the pins.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: does not work for my Nikon system
customer_reviews.text: Reader doesn't recognize Nikon NEF files on a CF card from D810 when card is mounted directly on this card reader. So, saving camera battery in the D810 when transferring photos from the CF card mounted on this card reader did not work for me. However, recovery of other and older deleted files from the card was fast and seemed reliable. For this purpose the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Rolf Bunger

customer_reviews.title: Love that now i can take advantage of my high-speed ...
customer_reviews.text: VERY cost effective 3.0 card reader upgrade. Love that now i can take advantage of my high-speed cards, not just in-camera but it also saves me a bunch of time copying from the media cards to my HDDs. If you have slower cards, you may not see much difference between a USB 2.0 and this 3.0 reader but if you have an 95 mb/s or 150 mb/s cards will copy BLAZINGLY fast and im so thankful for this. Only cost me $13. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Graves

customer_reviews.title: this is a great improvement over the builtin card reader
customer_reviews.text: Finally pulled the trigger on a SD card reader, this is a great improvement over the builtin card reader. Getting the advertised speed from the cards makes transferring images so much better. I am of the school of thought that with digital images you shoot like crazy and sort out the shots later, this reader makes the transfer painless on SDXC UHS I cards as I get as close as reasonable to advertised transfer rates, rather than 18Mbs from the builtin reader on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: James Undery

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money...this is the second time purchasing a Transcend multi-card reader. After only 3 months use, it no longer works. This item has been lightly used and mechanism that you plug the USB into is loose. My first Transcend reader corrupted 2 CF cards...I read the positive reviews and figured I would give it another try. I have had a Sony card reader for over 5 years and never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: larkisey

customer_reviews.title: Works great, it is fast, reads and writes every modern flash card.
customer_reviews.text: Tested CF, SD and microSD ports - they all appear as separate drive letters on the computer. Works well and has no problems maxing out the read speed of the card. I don't believe there are cards on the market that can operate faster than this can read or write. NIce blue light communicates status during read/write/other use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gafton

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried to copy & open image files from an SDHC memory card. All of the files had a prefix of "._" (no quotes). Adobe Photoshop 14 reported that there was an invalid jpeg marker and couldn't open the picture. I then borrowed a computer with a memory card reader. All of the files had normal names - that is no symbols as prefixes. The same program opened the files with no problem. Any ideas on what the problem is here? I guess I'll have to return the item if it doesn't correctly read the files..
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: This card reader worked fine for 7 months, then failed. Read speed dropped, extremely slow. 100 30meg images were loading with the predicted time of 4 hours. Compared to on older Transcend unit I have, which worked fine, and loaded all images in minutes. Glad I had a spare. I'll be buying something else this time.
customer_reviews.author: none-o-yo-biznez

customer_reviews.title: It worked!!  Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: It worked!!! Yeah!!!! Oh thank you, thank you! Apple changed its platform or OS again..whatever and I could no longer download pictures from my Canon A95 Powershot. I called Apple and I was told I needed to buy a new camera! WHAAAAAAT??? So I called Canon and they said to buy a RDF8 USB 3.0 card reader. I took the card out, plopped it in and....it worked immediately! Thank you tech gods! It has 5 different sized pukas (slots) so it could be used for a lot of different things. Now if Tim Cook can just keep his hands off Mac operating systems for awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Nuschler

customer_reviews.title: About 2 and a half times faster than USB 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Using a class 10 32 GB Transcend SDHC that held 4.70 GB of AVCHD movie and still photo records, I got these transfer rates (minutes:seconds): USB 2.0 SD card reader: 8:57 to transfer (8.75 MB/s) USB 3.0 (this one, Transcend) card reader: 3:26 to transfer (22.8 MB/s) So the USB 3 card reader was 2.6 times faster. That's a worthwhile speed increase. Interestingly, just using the camcorder's USB 2 output and cable, only 6:21 was needed to transfer the data, which is a little faster than via directly reading the SD card in a USB 2 reader but still 54% slower than with the USB 3 reader. Experienced no problems with this card reader running under Windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN_addict

customer_reviews.title: After 4 years a pin in the CF slot got bent and cannot be fixed
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if I should be happy or mad that I got four years of service. Maybe I should be upset with the design of CF cards whose connection depends upon 52 pins lining up with the holes every time you insert the card. That's what my camera uses so don't have much choice at this point. I'm going to buy another Transcend given the other choices.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: When used with my Samsung 128GB EVO U3 SD card I hit 93~95MBs consistency. With older compact flash cards I’m getting around 30 MBs but that’s the card not the card reader. With the larger files I’m getting from the DJI drone I’m glad to have a fast card reader.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Duck Football

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Transcend Multi-card Reader User
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done in a day and age that finds card readers and other input or export devices being removed from computers and compatible electronic devices. Had a USB 2.0 dependable unit that I gave to my daughter whose Apple did not have a card reader. Purchased my upgrade USB 3.0 replacement unit as my laptop reads SDHC but does not read compact flash cards and I use both. Happy with Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RGD WA

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for months, it remains plugged in and yet is rarely used but when I need to use it, it works fast. It's not hot to the touch (some are) and I get very fast speeds despite the fact that this Reader is plugged into a USB 3.0 hub and not directly into my computer. I have this mounted under my desk and out of sight and because of the position I decided to go with a "cheap" one. I have a more expensive one sitting on my work desk and they work exactly the same and have been equally reliable. I wished I'd just bought this one the first time around.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one year
customer_reviews.text: I needed a reader to handle CF cards to transfer pictures to my laptop. This reader had worked without fail. It fired up on my Windows 10 laptop with no issues... for a year 10/11/18 Update: After one year of use without fail the reader has failed. It can no longer work with any type of card... No CF or SD card that I plug in is acknowledged. It has become a boat anchor (for a very light weight boat). I'll give it 2 stars now because it did go a year before it tanked.
customer_reviews.author: Happy CamperTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good card reader
customer_reviews.text: Small, decent transfer rates. Quite a bit smaller than the Kingston card reader that I also use, works just as well. Sony memory sticks plug in around the back which is odd if you're into them, I'm not so it doesn't matter but putting the slot on the other side allows the device to be quite a bit narrower than others.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10 and also USB 2/3 compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this unit on high capacity SD cards. Works well with Windows 10 and plugged into a USB 2.0 port, (reader is capable of working with USB 3.0 but I have not tested it for functionality with that type of port.) I purchased this unit to transfer photographs from a Kodak camera SD Card to my Windows 10 computer. (The camera wasn't recognized after I updated to Windows 10. Updated drivers were not available, so I was unable to use the previous method, a USB transfer cable.)
customer_reviews.author: Dean Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Dump the old 2.0 reader.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Definite transfer speed improvement over my previous USB 2.0 card reader! If you're still using an older 2.0 reader and have an extra 3.0 port, it's worth the price. For my setup, I wish the cord was a little longer. I have a tower case that sits on the floor. The front USB 3.0 ports are near the bottom. It won't reach the top of my computer so the reader lays on the floor. No biggee, I'll buy a longer cord. Passing that on as the only snag I've hit so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Never worked piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in April. Tried to return today, July. We just opened this and it does not work period. It is a piece of garbage. I paid good money for this item and because I have not needed it until today I find out it does not work. Really bad stuff.
customer_reviews.author: AReviewer.of.online.Products

customer_reviews.title: Save you camera use this reader
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and even though you can extract the photos and video via cable my old camera the connection became worn and didn't connect all the time. This is by far a better way and just makes sense. Remove the card and plug into this reader that is connected to my PC and I use the PC to extract the photos and video without using my camera.I do a lot of YouTube content and this is what i use. I recommend this method to everyone just makes sense. This reader is great and was recommended to me by another great photographer and i cant think of any better way. Save your camera and use this
customer_reviews.author: Trikyriky

customer_reviews.title: This makes any memory card easy to upload.
customer_reviews.text: I srongly recomend this device. A lot of camras and newest servalance systems and computers has a slot for SD cards but there are other things that require a differant memory car tha don't fit the SD slot. Sowhen I have a decice that uses amemoey card other than SDs, I incert it into this devise and plug it into the USB port then upload the picturs. It's that easy.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: fast card reader with the slots we use most
customer_reviews.text: at work we use cameras with cf and sd card slots. our computers' built in card readers all break in the first months of use, so we always end up buying card readers. This one does the job great at a cheap price. Haven't had any issues with file corruption like I did with a cheaper card reader. USB 3.0 is fast. The micro sd slot didn't work on this unit, but we have a ton of the micro->standard sd adapters lying around so it's no biggie. Overall we're pleased and happy not to be sharing one card reader between the 3 of us anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Freakshow

customer_reviews.title: Great budget card reader that is reliable and fast.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good card reader that would be both fast and reliable that I could keep on my desk. I didn't want one of those elaborate ones that break the bank and this one fit the bill. When I transfer from my cards they all transfer at their rated speeds and I have not had a card unmount randomly like some cheaper readers I have come across. The included cable is a bit shorter than I would like, but I already had an additional cable sitting around.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: The reader had trouble reading my SD card - had to wiggle it around for my computer to recognize it. The computer recognizes the Transcend Reader but tried many different SD cards to see if it was the card. Nope. Should've returned it when i first noticed the problem...
customer_reviews.author: unknown

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little card reader
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little card reader. Reads about every card type out there, and the transfer speeds are nice and fast. The size is small, especially compared to some of the card readers I have had in the past. I ordered this with anticipation that I would be taking thousands of photos of my newborn, and I wasn't wrong. I am glad I have this reader, as the picture transfers are much faster than I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck P

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a device I could use for all my camera memory devices. I have SD, Micro SD and Flash. This unit works well with all those and has increased the speed of uploads to the computer. So far everything has worked flawlessly. I leave it connected to a port on a USB 3 hub and just plug in the card I need.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaMonkTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Love the product but with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: I have many Transcend products and they function extremely well. My only complaint is that their products come with a preconceived notion that the end user will be content with a connecting cable of limited length. An 18" cable is fine for connecting devices that are in close proximity to one another but for the desktop users, we are forgotten. It becomes necessary to purchase additional length cables to complete installation. I realize shorter cables mean smaller packaging and cost savings for the manufacturer but more cost for some of us who need a more customized installation.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: The product came promptly and in excellent condition. It performs in a flawless manner
customer_reviews.text: The product came promptly and in excellent condition. It performs in a flawless manner, on SD, Micro SD, and CF. With the SanDisk 16GB Ultra it consistently downloads files at around 30 MB/second. I have used it daily. If you insert the CF cord with care, and feeling in your fingers, so that you sense when you are inserting the pins of connection you will cause no bent pins. If you just shove in the CF problems could take place. THIS IN NO WAY IS A NEGATIVE ON THIS SUPERB PRODUCT. Just use common sense. Use this great product with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used it for over 2 years but its behavior was always unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June, 2016 and from day 1 it often required me to insert a card (CF or SD) more than once before the computer recognized it. But the problem has just gotten worse and today I had to insert an SD card over a dozen times before I could read it successfully, and one of those times it connected the card but wouldn't let me copy from it. So today I ordered a new one of a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Bass Islander

customer_reviews.title: Not Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Too finicky to be dependable. I've bought two of these, one for the studio and one for home. They both have times when they suddenly don't work at all. I'll look elsewhere moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the best reader I've ever used for SDHC cards
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best reader I've ever used for SDHC cards. It's dirt cheap and fast as hell. I haqve to dump full 64 GB cards onto my SSD after shoot and it moves them quickly without headache. My only real complaint is that the cord is a bit short (this is actually a good thing if you want to use it with a laptop on the go so it's great for students/travelers) but the device itself is tiny enough that I just leave it plugged in and sitting on top of my PC. Again, I've only used it for SDHC so I can't comment on any CF issues but it's been a rock for me.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to the other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviewers, this thing is buggy, even with the latest firmware, it's buggy. It'll work if you dork around with it but that's the thing, why should you have to mess with it to get it to sometimes work? I got this one to replace the Transcend card reader: Lexar Multi-Card 25-In-1 USB 3.0 Reader - LRW025URBNA
customer_reviews.author: bill704

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this to download files from the CF ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to download files from the CF, SD and microSD cards from my cameras and phones, and I haven't had a single issue with it. With smaller files, the sustained transfer rate is quite fast (at top 80% of the card's threshold), but with large files, the speed gets progressively slower during the transfer and eventually drops to about half. As far as I know, this is a common thing with SSD memory/storage, so I didn't deduct any points from the rating. If I'm wrong though, please let me know and I'll edit this review and the rating to reflect that.
customer_reviews.author: Lunatique

customer_reviews.title: Cant hang w my data
customer_reviews.text: I liked it for the price Using bmpcc4k camera and good imac & when i transfer files it gets hot and cuts out and comes back on my screen saying disk not ejected properly Got to wait til it cools to start again Its ok if you have a tiny file to transfer but if u are transferring large 4k files... Nope
customer_reviews.author: di

customer_reviews.title: Best reader for CF cards
customer_reviews.text: I've had several CF cards ruined by other card readers whose connector pins are not recessed far enough. If the pins are not recessed in the reader far enough, the card can go in crooked and bend the pins inside the reader. This will damage the connector on the CF card and any other cards inserted afterwards. This reader guides the CF card straight in so the tiny connector pins go into the card perfectly. Considering I had a couple of expensive 64G CF cards ruined by a cheap reader, this one is a bargain. I now have 3 of them
customer_reviews.author: Mr Giggity

customer_reviews.title: Memory card reader.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy for reading my SDHC memory cards with my laptop. The laptop does have a single slot for this but it requires an adaptor to read the smaller memory cards from my cell phone. This works perfectly. Easy to use, just plug it into any USB (including 3.0 support). Seems well made. Yes, plastic, but doesn't look or feel flimsy. Obviously no moving parts. I expect it to last forever. (Well, maybe a little less.) Has three different size slots, so it's versatile.
customer_reviews.author: kermitkabab

customer_reviews.title: Great cf card reader saved my pictures that I thought were lost
customer_reviews.text: I thought that I had lost all of our vacation photos when the cf card for my camera said that it didn't have any pictures to download. I bought this little transcend card reader and the free image recovery software and it worked like a champ. It found our vacation photos and more. It found pictures that I took 5 years ago and I had formatted that cf card multiple times since. This reader worked great and it's an eye opener too. Your cf card still retains the data even if you deleted the pictures and formatted the card, don't just throw them in the trash...they have to be destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: bobj401

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! It kept on freezing my computer. I bought it as a backup in case my other card reader goes bad while traveling. I have no problems with the other one and it's not particularly expensive or high quality (same price range). I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very short cable is impractical for desktop computers
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for about a month and it works great. I haven't had any of the issues mentioned by other users, using a Canon 7D camera and a Windows 7/64 bit system. My only complaint: the cable it comes with. It's really short and thick, which is probably great for a laptop, but I work on a desktop computer and I wanted to have the card reader on my desk, so I had to buy another regular length cable (about 1.5m I guess?) in order to put it on my desk and plug it to my desktop computer sitting below. Just another detail to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian P. F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, works fine
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and it worked great downloading large images from CD card. One minor downside and one caveat - I don't see a "mounted" light, which my old lexar has (this seems to have an activity light where flashing OFF is activity), so you have to check on windows if it's still mounted to remove the card. And caveat, I replaced an old reader and didn't reboot and it did not work, a drive conflict; a reboot fixed it. Unit works fine, very fast. Cord is short but nicely heavy feeling. Excellent value considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Linwood

customer_reviews.title: Transcend USB 3.0 Super Speed Multi Reader
customer_reviews.text: I read many card reader reviews and settled on this one mostly because of price point AND because users of other brand card readers complained about card pin damage with insertion. I have had no problems with this reader and carry it with my USB 2.0 MacBook Pro whenever I travel with my camera. It is very compact. It will download an 8 GB CF card in less than 2 minutes (really an estimate I haven't timed it). It is fast with my SDHC cards as well. Cable is comfortably long but not too long. I usually leave it coiled up. Very heavy gauge cable and USB connections. Should last. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Doc

customer_reviews.title: I hope they are not all this bad.
customer_reviews.text: I may have just received a lemon. I was able to initially transfer photos seamlessly from the card to the computer. Not long after purchasing, the reader began to mount/unmount repeatedly with the computer, without any wires or physical pieces being moved/ nudged. I should have returned it, but I figured I could deal with it, not wanting to deal with the hassle of returning. Now the item has become more work than it is worth. On my last transfer of possibly 3 or 4 gb. The reader unmounted five times, making me restart the transfer process each time. I will just ending up throwing this one out, and finding a better replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play for Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Just plugged it in and it works. I'm running Windows 10. I didn't load any drivers as Windows must already have them. Transfered my 4k video files fast. The cord is short at around 18 inches but I just added Velcro to attach it to my desktop case. Laptop users shouldn't have a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: PapPap

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 4 years of daily use
customer_reviews.text: My first one lasted 4 years before the it started corrupting files, I had CF cards in and out of it nearly every day so I probably wore out the pins... Although my camera hasn't failed and it's had the same usage... Anyway, good enough to have replaced it with another identical one, but not good enough to get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RedRinger

customer_reviews.title: Good little reader.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is quick. The only drawback is that you can only read one card at a time. I was going to use it to clone micro SD cards, but when you put in a second card it draws too much power so it hangs the reader. It's light, so the cord manipulates the thing on the desk if you don't mount it with something like hook and loop (velcro) tape it might walk on you.
customer_reviews.author: Version One

customer_reviews.title: Great Card Reader, Cable is Sad.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this card reader as an upgrade from my little old USB 2.0 no-name reader. Initially the product was sturdy and looked well made, but when I got to the cable I was disappointed. It's maybe a foot long. I normally have my card reader under one of my monitors, and my usb 3.0 port is about 3-4 feet away. My WD external HDD came with a decent length USB 3.0 cable, so for now I'll just have to use that. Otherwise this card reader works well, quick transfers with my 32gb Extreme Plus card, and for the price you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, 2 day shipping and easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: As expected, prompt delivery. Bought this along with a Compact Flash for my older model DSLR canon Rebel XTi camera. It is plug and play--in other words, you simply in put the memory card (4 size options), and plug into the computer USB port with included USB cord into your computer. Voila! The computer recognizes the reader and asks what you'd like to do with the files. I opened them and downloaded my pictures. So easy and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Lover

customer_reviews.title: which is can be good if you want portable
customer_reviews.text: This is amazingly fast with fast CF and SD cards. Warning, the included cable is only about 18". Probably too short for most desktop use and too long for portable use. Cards inserted and ejected smoothly which can be a problem with CF as it uses two rows of pins. It is amazingly small too, which is can be good if you want portable, but I use this with a great big tower computer in my home office. I would prefer a built in card reader, but it is really tough to find one that is of decent quality and uses USB 3.0 Card Readers and has front audio ports.
customer_reviews.author: D. Swager

customer_reviews.title: I made this purchase exactly one year ago and it's still working great. I am thoroughly impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be honest, I had my doubts. I imagined having it breaking on me at an instant from the price or have little to no use after a while. I made this purchase exactly one year ago and it's still working great. I am thoroughly impressed. I've been using this with my compact flash memory card and it does not disappoint. Highly recommend. But just know; this item is not the best in terms of quality. It WILL break if mistreated or any harsh use on removing and inserting the cord. UPDATE: Going on four years of this purchase and is still doing beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works for 1 year, then Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1 year, and now it's hit or miss. Every time I'm transferring a lot of photos from a CF or SD card onto my computer, the transcend reader stops working after transferring maybe 20-40 files. You can imagine the headache of me having to transfer 20-40 files at a time especially after shooting a wedding in which I might have 2000+ photos to transfer. This is not a reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: nowknow411

customer_reviews.title: This worked great.
customer_reviews.text: This Transcend Card Reader worked great, right out of the box! I bought it to replace a cheap card reader, included with a Canon camera package I recently purchased, that quit working the third time I used it. I was worried about this card reader's compatibility with Windows 7 and USB 2.0 on my old PC, but it worked just fine. A USB cord is included, about 18 inches long, which enables me to plug in the USB Cord in my PC, and set the reader on top of my PC. I am able to download photos from my new camera, using the new SDHC cards. My old PC with Windows 7 wouldn't read them without the card reader.
customer_reviews.author: Montanan

customer_reviews.title: Completely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Got this yesterday, unpacked, plugged in and within seconds was downloading photos from an older compact flash card. USB 3 makes this thing really fast. Downloaded over 500M of photos literally in seconds. Has a really heavy duty cable included which is great, and will probably last forever, but it is a little stiff, limiting where and how you can place the unit. As I don't need this hooked up all the time it is not really an issue. For the price, I can't imagine that you could get a more versatile, well build and fast unit.
customer_reviews.author: RPM

customer_reviews.title: Light, small, fast...and will support high-capacity cards!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few Card Readers that will support ultra-high capacity cards (256GB, etc) correctly...and will transfer them as fast as the card can go at. I myself am shooting a lot of Magic Lantern RAW / MLV video, and hence being able to reliably & quickly move that data is a necessity. Also, it is a lot smaller than you think -- it fits very easily in my bag; for whatever reason, from the pictures I thought it was bulky.
customer_reviews.author: The Active Geek

customer_reviews.title: Best deal. Cardreader and recovery software that works
customer_reviews.text: Had a few other SD card readers which often are not reliable. Once even led to the SC card from our camera becoming corrupt. Tried various recovery software but all detected nothing and wanted reformat it again. This card ready works great on our Wind 7pro system. The USB 3.0 works great. Just recovered 30Gigs of data from my SD card with the Transend recovery software that is free from their website. This is worth more than the price of this card reader. My wife will be thrilled to get her vacation pictures back. Now I now why this product had more stars than the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Albert D_Saratoga

customer_reviews.title: Fast on Big file Transfer
customer_reviews.text: This reader is very fast on big file transfer. On little files it is not much different than a usb2 reader. USB3 devices are generally limited by the speed of their data sources and that applies here so there is not much difference in speed on small files but large files in the 10mb up category do seem to transfer substantially quicker. The fit of the cards in the sockets is good [I only checked the 3 formats I own CF-SD-MicroSD] and the overall construction feels substantial...A rubberized base would be nice so it would grip the surface of the desk and not slide around. especially when your doing a one hand insert. Overall the product works well.
customer_reviews.author: bitbob

customer_reviews.title: It has been really great for reading CF cards out of my wife's Nikon ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really understand how much faster a dedicated card reader plugged into a USB 3 port would be than most devices that I was plugging in to the computer to read SD cards (Cameras, phones, etc). This little guy doesn't get in your way, it holds all the cards, and it is fast. It has been really great for reading CF cards out of my wife's Nikon D810. I wish I had gotten a dedicated card reader sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Doc sav

customer_reviews.title: It works great except for the very reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this reader to work with a Sandisk SDHC card, which is the card I use for my digital camera. It works for everything else, but I had to buy another reader for my camera, intending to return this. But, as a usual procrastinator, I let the return window pass. That's why it's getting three stars. It works, but just not what I need it for. For my next camera, I'll buy something other than Sandisk and this will go back to working correctly again.
customer_reviews.author: Wasted Youth

customer_reviews.title: Pretty flexible, lacking USB 3.1
customer_reviews.text: There is another model that's a bit more capable than this - the TS-RDF9K, which adds USB 3.1 speeds for data transfer. If you are not all that concerned with that extra boost of data transfer, then this model will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Mankins

customer_reviews.title: I used to use a very expensive card reader for speed but the construction of that one was kind of lame. So on a whim
customer_reviews.text: Anyone looking for a card reader should buy this. Inexpensive, reliable, consistent. I used to use a very expensive card reader for speed but the construction of that one was kind of lame. So on a whim, I figured I'd try transcends because I buy a lot of memory cards from them. Let me say I was pleasantly surprised and want to buy a few more for different office locations. Love that it'll take CF, SD, micro, etc.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: this thing does what it's supposed to at usb 3.0 speeds as long as you have usb 3.0 built into your computer. it's also usb 2.0 compatible my father tried it out and found it very useful so now i am buying one for him as well since he takes alot of pictures. definitely would recommend this to anyone who takes alot of photos and is on the go constantly. i bought this 2/24/2014 at $14.95 and buying it for my father at the price of $11.73 - 2/3/2016
customer_reviews.author: Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great all around drive that works great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use on a USB 3.0 port along with 400x Transcend CF cards that I use in my Canon Camera. The computer (Windows 8 machine) recognized it immediately and every time I insert the card it immediately is read. You know the reader is powered as there is a blue light on it that lets you know. Downloading a couple hundred photos takes no time at all and is significantly faster that plugging the USB cord directly into the camera. I haven't watched the actual speed rates however, so I cannot comment onto actual download speeds. Will try and update when i fill several cards worth of photos and download them all at once.
customer_reviews.author: MikeInCleveland

customer_reviews.title: Choose me!
customer_reviews.text: This one works! There are several other compact media card readers; many are flimsy or simply don't work. This one is a sturdy, quality product. Cards slip in without fearing you will bend pins. The wide range of media which it receives as well as capable of USB 3.0 speed also makes it valuable. The only feature I wish it included was that the USB cable were a short, connected rat tail. This would make it even more compact for travel.
customer_reviews.author: JBird

customer_reviews.title: Great card reader
customer_reviews.text: Great card reader, FAST, bought it for my micro sd so I can get my go pro footage off it it! Here is the kicker though... I had a corrupted micro SD card in my android and tried everything to recover it on my laptop since it had a internal card reader. I was about to wipe it and I said let me try to recover it again on my desktop now that I have a card reader for it... Soon as I plug it in THIS card reader read it, I copied over everything immediately and was able to recover some very valuable photos that I did not back up of while I was deployed.
customer_reviews.author: Jordon

customer_reviews.title: Transcend USB 3.0 Super Speed Multi-Card Reader for SD/SDHC/SDXC/MS/CF Cards (TS-RDF8K): The need for transfer speed
customer_reviews.text: This is not a professional grade card reader/hub, but it's super great for personal photos or videos. I have a Canon DSLR that I fill up 16-32 GB SD cards with, and I've never had any problems downloading my photos onto my CPU or external drives. It doesn't have a slot for most high-grade memory cards, but it does have a CF reader, which is really convenient. It has USB 3.0 which offers the fastest transfer on my Mac, outside of the Thunderbolt port. It move it around a lot, and usually keep its USB cord unplugged in transit so it doesn't get messed up, but it's lasted for a few years now and I'm still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: SaucyPuppetShow

customer_reviews.title: Solid system
customer_reviews.text: I had been having troubles with files becoming corrupted when downloading with my previous card reader. The same card had no trouble downloading onto my MAC with this reader. It is fast and a great compact size. I read reviews on this reader and it was rated as the best in value, I would throughly agree!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Use it on a Mac. Much faster than my ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it on a Mac. Much faster than my camera (which is likely USB 2.0). Update 4/26/17: I got a 128GB SDXC card and this reader doesn't "see" it. My camera does and using a SDHX adapter on the same Mac sees it. Hmmmmm, very odd. This definitely makes this reader much less useful to me.
customer_reviews.author: e40

customer_reviews.title: I debated buying something like this, but since my older Canon Powershot G3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I debated buying something like this, but since my older Canon Powershot G3 Camera driver isn't compatible with Windows 7, I decided to look into a multi-card reader so I can download my pictures. I received it and have used it a few times. I'm amazed how easy it was to hook up (usb) and windows 7 recognized the device immediately. I just slid the SD Compact Flash drive into the device and uploaded all of the images. Fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pat K

customer_reviews.title: ports fail and pins bend
customer_reviews.text: flimsy. ports can't be read, they fail and the pins inside bend. there is no indication on how to insert the cards. And once you insert it wrong, you damaged the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Sacha Aponte de Roeck

customer_reviews.title: I'm back in business on windows 10 platform.
customer_reviews.text: I had an IOGEAR model that I purchased during the windows 7 days. It worked until maybe at the beginning of win10 then the drivers just went all wonky. Perhaps it never worked at all in windows 10, I'm not sure now. The Transcend one works with Windows 10 over front usb 3.0 port and getting around ~40-47MB/s transfer from an Extreme III CF card.
customer_reviews.author: fireNice

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied about this product
customer_reviews.text: This is Donna's son Paul. I purchased Transcend's USB 3.0 Memory card reader on August 16th, 2013. Today is June 12th, 2014. I have zero complaints about this product. It hasn't failed me once. Even though it is USB 3.0, it works great with USB 2.0 ports on the iMac Early 2008 with Mavericks OS X. Absolutely love this product. My photography teacher had recommended this product, and apparently the quality is better when transferred on a memory card reader. Not sure if that is true, but the quality of the photos and videos transferred from my T3i are great. Great speed, great performance, what else could a customer ask for?
customer_reviews.author: dharw

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, fast and rugged USB 3.0 multi-card reader
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd copy of this USB 3.0 multi-card reader I have ordered. Works perfectly and fast! (I lost the first one, but miraculously found it after placing order for the replacement. Funny how that always happens :)
customer_reviews.author: Vivman

customer_reviews.title: Small, Durable
customer_reviews.text: Small, cheap, have taken this to multiple countries in my backpack for filming and is still as fast as ever! I use a 150 MB/s CF card in the reader and transfers are blazing. The card limits the speed, not the reader. I daresay you won't be able to get cards fast enough to max out this reader. The USB cable is short (1 foot) as mentioned in other reviews. I think it's great, as it reduces overall size. Don't forget that USB 3.0 will work just fine with USB 2.0 ports. Construction feel cheap, but heck, this reader is cheap. And it gets the job done. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Logan V.

customer_reviews.title: Great reader, but needs longer cord.  Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Have tried SDHC and SD cards with a USB 3.0 port and it flies. Its amazing how much faster reading photos from cards is now...it used to take forever for Lightroom to import photos from my cards. I also tested it with 64GB Compact Flash cards and those worked great too. I only wish the USB 3.0 cable it came with was longer...its far shorter than my previous reader's cable and I often have it dangling from the front of the computer. Will have to buy a longer USB 3.0 cord now
customer_reviews.author: Fremen

customer_reviews.title: outstanding product and great delivery
customer_reviews.text: hello, if you need a fast sd card reader, this is the one. we have several sd card slots in various computers and peripheral devices. this one is the fastest to read and transfer. it is a 3.0, but can utilize a regular sd card and plug into any 2.0 usb slot. we used a class 10 lexar and class 10 sandisk card to transfer images and videos from our cameras to the home computer. fast is what we observed over other times when we put the card into a printer sd card slot. yrmv super fast delivery and hooks up anywhere...
customer_reviews.author: jnaki

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my canon 5d mkiii I was in need of a CF card reader but didn't want to spend a ton of money I one. I came across this transcend 3.0 and it fit my requirements so I purchased it. So far it has done everything I need it to but I have one small complaint. Every now and then It doesn't want to read my card and I have to unplug it from the computer and plug it back in and it starts working. Not a huge deal but a little annoying. Overall I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Would recommend for travel and various applications.
customer_reviews.text: Both the casing and the USB3 connection port are build very well. I used this to backup console files from a Yamaha PM5D SD card to my computer. Mac OS sees this as just another mounted drive, but only if you insert an SD card. It's actually quite nice. The included USB3 cable is short, but that's what I wanted. I also leave the cable attached to the card reader. It's been tossed around in my backpack for awhile now, and the cable hasn't come unplugged, but there's definitely no magic locking mechanism or anything - the cable just fits the port snugly as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Fleabyte

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after 2 weeks of very light use. :( Maybe it's a defective product. Transcend usually has decent products. I will return and try another one.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Reola

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this card reader to take photos off of old Sony memory sticks. I looked at many different products before choosing this one and I am pleased with the speed of this card reader, as well as its ability to read a variety of different kinds of memory cards.
customer_reviews.author: MaggiePark73

customer_reviews.title: Compact and speedy.
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with this product so far. I had been using a Lexar card reader that is indicated as USB 3 but into a USB 2 port on a Mac Pro 2008. Having installed a USB 3 card into the Mac, the Lexar reader actually got /slower/ at read speeds. This Transcend reader is much faster. I'm seeing 80MB/s write and 110MB/s read to a Lexar Pro 1066x CF card. The unit itself is nice and compact. The only beef is that the included USB 3 cable is stiff enough that the tiny reader won't lay flat.
customer_reviews.author: Analog Kid

customer_reviews.title: Great product...Description is Spot On!
customer_reviews.text: Read the description and you'll have everything you need to know in order to purchase. I just received, so can't legitimately speak for durability, but it appears to be a very solid product that works seamlessly. Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Char_from_Chi

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and affordable card reader but remember that it can't read SD and MicroSD at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: Convenient, quick and affordable device for accessing the many types of flash memory that folks might have laying around. I wish I had read one of the already posted reviews about the device not being able to read regular SD and microSD at the same time as it took me some time to figure that out on my own after initially thinking the device was defective. If it wasn't for that limitation this would be a five star product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Villiger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Get this reader.
customer_reviews.text: I think I spent a few extra dollars to get this over a simpler model. You never know what responsibilities you'll have on semi-pro and especially pro-bono productions. Those few extra dollars were totally worth it when I was suddenly handed a CF card on set and expected to transfer footage in a hurry. Otherwise, I generally use it for the standard SDHC and SDXC memory cards when I'm at home. Whatever your purpose, I'd recommend having this thing on hand if there's a chance you need to transfer digital stills or footage.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: Insanely fast
customer_reviews.text: Card Readers. Who knew they'd be the biggest part of our work flow aside from Cabling the camera directly to the computer. I, for one, hate that with a passion. So I bought this USB 3.0 Card Reader. By far the best decision I've ever made. It's ridiculously fast, I mean insanely fast. It dumped my 64gb SDXC card in less than 7 minutes at full capacity. So that's saying something. And the fact that if you don't have the 3.0 ports yet it'll still work, just without all the extra speed. By far, Trascend has been coming up on my list of hot buy items. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dgardner1988

customer_reviews.title: Great little reader!
customer_reviews.text: Tried with all minus the Sony slots. Works well with microSD, SDHC/SDXC and CF cards. Having the new USB 3.0 helps a lot especially downloading tons of photos as I shoot with Canon 5DMKIII and the file size can be enormous depending on how much I've shot. It does come with a short USB 3.0 cord. With my HP laptop sometimes it doesn't recognize it but just re-inserted and seems to work without any issue. It's also very compact so traveling with it is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: AkiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, reads/writes most anything
customer_reviews.text: I used the Transcend USB 3.0 card reader for reading and writing 1Gb and 4.0Gb SD cards, although it can read most anything. Read and write speed was very fast, especially using a USB 3.0 port. Finally, I have a method for backing up and transferring my photos and music files. I had a slight hardware glitch when first using the card reader, but it went away after ejecting the card reader and re-plugging it. It has been flawless since. I attribute the glitch to capacitors forming (breaking in), inside the card reader itself. At this point, I am prepared to read, write, or copy most any size/format cards.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and worked right out of the box, no need to read instruction.
customer_reviews.text: The cord is only about a foot long which I wish was a bit longer for my use, but it still works well. I needed a new card reader right away to be able to read the higher class of sd cards. This turned out to be a perfect solution for the cost. Although, I probably won't be using the write capabilities it looks like it would be very easy. The box itself is about 1.5 by about 2.5 inches. It has a blue light indicator that lets you know it is plugged in. Very easy to find on the computer. No need to read instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Weaver

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, for a while.
customer_reviews.text: Well this card reader did its job, nothing special, I never noticed it being slower or faster than anything not USB 3.0. It was inexpensive, so I'm not too bothered, but now it doesn't work at all. It was in a drawer, only used once a week sometimes twice, but it was never handled rough. 3 year shelf life, just don't expect a durable item.
customer_reviews.author: Senor Burns

customer_reviews.title: small, fast and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use this little bad boy after every shoot.. I use CF cards and this little guy is just big enough to do the job without being in the way. I love that it's 3.0 because my RAW camera files are pretty darn big.. so I need all the speed I can get. Im tempting myself to buy another one of these for while I'm typing this out for when Im on the go and can leave it in my backpack. I use this with a Mac and haven't had any issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: This item is Crap
customer_reviews.text: At first purchase it was questionable but worked often. Soon afterwards it spiraled. Now a few months after first use it fails more than works. You cannot rely on or should you use this product for your important photo transfers.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but the built quality is average. USB cable pretty hard to insert into the box, also the input socket a bit crooked. On the other side , the SD card socket is pretty weak.
customer_reviews.author: Evgeny

product_meta.title: Transcend USB 3.0 Super Speed Multi-Card Reader for SD/SDHC/SDXC/MS/CF Cards (TS-RDF8W)
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteUnleash the full potential of your high-speed memory cards with the Rdf8 USB 3.0 card reader. Support for all new card formats combined with the performance boost of advanced USB 3.0 technology make the Rdf8 the professional’s choice for fast and efficient data transfer.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Unleash the full potential of high-speed memory cards with the RDF8 USB 3.0 card reader! The RDF8 offers blazing fast transfers with USB 3.0 interface, making it perfect for professional photographers to effortlessly copy a large number of images. The RDF8 provides a total of four slots, one CF, one SDHC/SDXC, one M2/microSD, and one MS PRO/XC/MS DUO. It supports all new card formats including SDHC UHS-1, SDXC UHS-1, UDMA6/UDMA7 CF and MSXC cards. Backwards compatible with USB2.0, the RDF8 is the ideal companion for your present and future data management needs.
feature_bullets: Super-Speed USB 3.0 interface (also compatible with USB 2.0)
Supports SDHC UHS-1, SDXC UHS-1, UDMA6/UDMA7 CF and MSXC cards
LED card insertion / data transfer activity indicator
Transfer high-resolution images and video recordings to your computer faster and more efficiently
USB powered (no external power or battery needed)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,768 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
